intro: Neolitsea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan litsea, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the lowland forests of New Guinea. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and has smooth, dark green foliage with a slightly glossy surface. Its fruit is a small, spherical drupe that turns from green to red when mature, attracting various bird species. Neolitsea papuana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and providing food and shelter for local wildlife.
